page.title: 02Inns of Wooler
page.content: Old inns and public houses included The Sun Inn, at the top of The Peth, where the Rendezvous Cafe is now, and at the other side of the archway The Royal Arms.The Wheatsheaf was there and next door,facing the Market Place was the Seven Stars.On the corner of Ramsey's Lane(Strangeways Shop) was The White Horse and on the site of Bryson's the bakers was yet another inn. The Anchor Inn is an original Wooler establishment. Most of the inns were supplied by the Coldstream Brewery plus the local ale from the St.Magnus Brewery in Brewery Lane.The latter is now a social club.Today there is also The Black Bull,the Red Lion,the Tankerville Hotel and the Ryecroft Hotel.
